reviewText: How can I review this game? I have no idea what I am supposed to do or how to do it. There are no instructions, guide (manual) and no tutorial. No help button. I can find no help nor info on the Internet. The graphics are horrible. Unsuitable for high res. Is this an early access game? I mean what is this doing on Steam? It may be a good game. I don't know because I can't play it. A price of $17 seems ridiculous from what I have experienced so far. I would like to play and enjoy this game as I like business sims so any help or guidance would be appreciated. Back to CapitalismLab for me.

reviewText: I really don't know what the description of this game is going on about, calling itself an Economic studio". While the economic model is interesting: unowned laborers decide where to live/work based on distance and cost/salary
date: the AI games have no settings or options
recommended: just everyone thrown in together on one tiny map where the AI will always make roughly the same decisions and outcomes
voteText: tiny industrial blob. The tools to view the in-game economy that has developed are underpowered and unhelpful
helpfulPercent: and it is basically impossible to find the information you would need to micromanage your production.\n\nAside from that

column16: but my client wasn't able to connect to their matchmaking servers.\n\nRunning the game just to see what kind of economy the AI will set up can be mildly interesting the first time

column20: and without being able to discern any useful information for its impact on the game's economy. Once the AI fills up the incredibly tiny map you just have to sit around tweaking numbers and hoping one of the other companies goes out of business eventually so that it clears up a few tiny plots of land for whatever you had planned next.\n\nMaybe I'm not supposed to look at this as a "Game"
